content.description: This route is the best at the crag. It is a great route that traverses the majority of the wall. Head up toward the OW, and head right following the diagonal about 7 or 8 feet past the main vertical crack. Then balance move up onto the face, and head straight up and left to the bolted anchor.
content.location:
Start at same place as the

Left Offwidth

.

content.description: This is a wide crack with sharp crystals similar to those of Vedauwoo although a lot of face climbing is involved. When the crack goes right, follow it to the bolted anchor. This route could use some cleaning, as there are a couple "suspect" blocks in the crack that could (should) come out.
content.protection: A light rack up to a #4 Camalot.
content.location: This is the wide crack located on the far left side of the wall.

content.description: This is a great route that goes straight up the splitter crack in the center of the wall. Just wish it was longer. Leave the namesake bone where it is.
content.location: The obvious, vertical crack halfway up the ramp.

content.description:
Climb the face up and slightly left using small sloping divots in the polish to the diagonal crack and finish on "

Prime Real Estate Crack

". This route has not yet been lead. The lack of any gear till you get through the tough climbing (25 feet?) would make this a scary lead.
content.location: Maybe 8 feet to the right of "Bone Crack".

pathTokens: Devil's Gulch and Dry Gulch Roads
